intro: Swertia punicea var. lutescens, commonly known as the yellow swertia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. This variant is distinguished by its vivid yellow coloration, which sets it apart from other varieties of Swertia.
